newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam, China railway passenger service delayed.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam, China railway passenger service delayed.

text.p: Vietnamese rail officials said on Monday that plans to resume a cross-border passenger service on a meandering colonial line between Hanoi and China's southwest city of Kunming had run into delays.
The train service, reopened for freight a year ago, was expected to begin moving passengers in December. But plans have run into what were described as technical problems on the Chinese side.
"It's been delayed by a few months. There is no timetable yet for when any service might begin," said a state executive with Vietnam Railway in Hanoi.
An official who declined to be identified said the two countries had reached ministerial-level agreement that the plan should go ahead, but China now appeared to be dragging its feet.
The two socialist neighbours restored rail links at two points on their mutual border in February last year, 17 years after they were severed by a bloody border war.
While the move was seen as symbolically important the lines have failed so far to prove a commercial success.

The Hanoi-Kunming rail freight-link has yet to become the significant conduit for trade, while passenger traffic on a Hanoi-Beijing route via Lang Son in Vietnam and China's Nanning is running at a substantial loss.
